intro: Argostemma setosum var. hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy argostemma, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft pubescence. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
